title.narrative: PNG Health Education and Clinical Services

description.narrative: Funding under this initiative supports the University of Papua New Guinea (UPNG) School of Medicine and Health Sciences (SMHS) deliver health worker training and specialised medical services through the Health Education and Clinical Services (HECS) program. HECS is a new program which amalgamates two older programs, the Medical School Support Program (MSSP) and the Tertiary Health Services (THS) program. HECS is a more integrated program of support for immediate and longer term health workforce development needs, and aims to strengthen the institutional capacity of SMHS. The program will also ensure AusAID resources are used to support the SMHS's own objectives as set out in their 5 year strategic plan. Another important feature of HECS is its flexibility to support training in a broader range of health worker cadres, such as nurses and midwives, as determined by the SMHS.
